markdown.headingText: Textual Analysis and Natural Language Processing (NLP)
markdown.markdown:
- Applying text-based methods to extract meaningful economic signals and indices: - **ESG and Sustainability Indicators:** Developing novel Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics from textual data for evaluation and risk assessment (*Core of PhD Thesis*). - **Consistency Index of Authorship:** Designing algorithms to detect and analyze the mindset embedded in economics textbooks, with applications to macroeconomic research (*Work in progress*). - **Dictionary-Based Methods:** Creating and refining categorized text-based dictionaries to capture central ideas, particularly in multilingual economic texts (*PRIN-LEXECON project*). - **Sentiment Analysis and Topic Modeling:** Leveraging sentiment extraction and topic modeling to support risk assessment and economic forecasting. - **Data Scraping:** Collecting and structuring unstructured data for analysis and model development.
# Econometrics and Time Series Analysis - Capturing dynamics, risk, and volatility in economic and financial data. - **Macroeconomic Time Series:** Modeling and forecasting macroeconomic variables, with attention to external drivers such as policy changes and commodity price fluctuations (*Final chapter of PhD thesis*). - **Volatility Analysis:** Specializing in long-term volatility modeling using mixed-frequency data and advanced GARCH-type approaches (e.g., GARCH-MIDAS). - **Risk Management:** Applying econometric methods to measure financial risk, including Value at Risk (VaR) and Expected Shortfall (ES). - **Time-Frequency Analysis:** Employing **Continuous Wavelet techniques** (e.g., in combination with the Ornstein–Uhlenbeck process) to study time series across multiple scales.
# Programming and Statistical Modeling - Leveraging specialized software for data analysis, econometric modeling, and visualization: - **Python:** Skilled in natural language processing (NLP), web scraping, and general data analysis. - **R:** Extensive experience in econometrics, time series modeling, and risk management (VaR, ES, GARCH). - **MATLAB:** Applied to specialized time-frequency analysis of economic and financial time series (Wavelets). - **LaTeX** and **Microsoft Office:** Proficient in academic writing, technical documentation, and professional presentation.
